text: Beverley Joan "Bev" Oda, PC, MP (born July 27, 1944) is a Canadian teacher, television broadcaster and politician. She was the first Japanese-Canadian member of the House of Commons of Canada.Parliament of Canada, "ODA, The Hon. Bev, P.C., B.A." ; retrieved 2012-12-3. ==Early life, education== Oda was born in Thunder Bay, Ontario. She was the daughter of Japanese Canadian parents. She was a Sansei, which means that she was the granddaughter of people born in Japan who immigrated to Canada."Beverley (Bev) Oda" at National Association of Japanese Canadians ; retrieved 2012-12-3. Oda earned a degree from the University of Toronto.Notable Names Database (NNDB), "Bev Oda"; retrieved 2012-12-3. ==Career== Oda was the first Japanese-Canadian to be appointed a Cabinet Minister.
